column5: Thiguka's phonotactics allow saying Tagalog without modifications, so it is the exact same.

Because ['ɹusia] sounds too far from the English pronunciation and 
Thiguka has no [ʌ], Thiguka instead borrows from the native Russian 
pronunciation [rɐˈsʲijə].
Because Thiguka words may not end in -r, -l, or -k, a dummy -a is added.

column4:
dormant person feeling;
to feel the dormant person feeling, i.e. to be curious, with concern, for a person who has disappeared and has not been heard from, especially on the Internet
column5:
The dormant person feeling is a type of feeling experienced by Lemuria when he encounters dormant people who have not posted in several years. It is best described as a mix of unease, concern, empathy, and curiosity.

To alleviate this feeling, Lemuria often attempts to investigate the person to find their most recent postings; such as within the last month or week, to determine if they are alive.
